title: Lettering on vintage French posters (1900)
content:
Does anyone know of any typefaces similar to either of these?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821145321im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/paris1900_5353.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821145321im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Paris1900Cover_4356.GIF)

 [‹ (x) M&M Transport logo - Quaint Gothic (Desdemona) {Adriano S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821145321/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37752 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Be Bubbly 50s script - Mr Dehaviland {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821145321/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37754 "Go to next forum topic")
author: j3nny129

comments.content:
You should be able to find a nice selection of similar styles by searching with 1800s or Victorian, for starters. Art Nouveau is also roughly this time period. Sometimes ’Antique’ will also work.

There is one typeface there (FLEURET, etc) that resembles Copperplate Gothic. [HF Exposition](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821145321/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=Exposition&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2CRF) is also roughly this vintage in terms of style

- Mike Yanega
